Backend.skills: Python, SQL, Microservices, Strong OO skills, Unit testing, Deep exp w/ a 2nd language like C++ or Java
Backend.jobDescription:
PolySign Senior Back End Engineer


As a Senior Backend Engineer at PolySign you will help architect and build the business logic and backbone services for the PolySign crypto-currency platform. You will build central services such as the account, firm, and vault managers that form the backbone of our system, and connect them to the PolySign front end systems which include web and mobile platforms.

In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on both architecture and direction. You will interface with and assist the front end and cloud services teams to help launch our platform.


What you’ll do:

Architect and build the PolySign back end working with cloud services team, and front end team to produce a world-class fintech service
Build quality in, delivering significant unit, integration and system tests along with your code
Write developer documentation, reference implementations, and other educational content as needed
As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed

 

What we are looking for:


We’re looking for passionate, professional software engineers who enjoy doing things the right way. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of python and the python ecosystem, as well as code security, scalability, quality and sustainability. Deep experience with another language, like C++ or Java, will be very useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position. As a software professional, you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members and teams.

 

Required Skills:

At least 2 years experience building enterprise grade software using python and related technologies. Deep knowledge of python and python libraries.
Deep experience with a second language like C++ or Java
Extensive experience with:
Object oriented concepts and design patterns
Unit and system testing
Software security concepts and best practices
Experience with
Conceiving, developing and vetting new software architectures
Microservice architectures
SQL and NoSQL
Track record of writing high quality, sustainable, testable, performant code using best software development practices
Strong sense of software craftsmanship, professionalism and responsibility
Understanding of Agile estimating and planning methods, and a record of estimating and delivering to schedule
BS in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience

 

Bonus Skills:

Knowledge of Javascript and modern javascript user interface libraries such as React
Experience with mobile development using React Native
Experience with electronic financial exchanges and markets
Experience with cryptography, particularly digital currency

 

Key Technologies:

Front End: Javascript, React and React Native
Backend: Python, Node, C++, postgresql, websockets, ZeroMQ, Docker
OS: Linux

 

What we offer:

The opportunity to join a well funded, cutting edge financial technology company at a very early stage
Competitive salary and equity
Competitive medical benefits
Generous 401K matching plan
Flexible working policies: work with your manager to determine the best combination of work at office/work from home arrangements
A software culture that values quality, sustainability and craftsmanship over time to market
Smart co-workers who are world class experts in the field of crypto-currency
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact

 

Who we are:


PolySign is a stealth mode startup in the San Francisco Bay Area working in the area of institutional custody for cryptocurrencies. Our solution will be a key component to the mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies. Cryptocurrencies are an exciting emerging market with considerable opportunities for success. As member of a small, world class technical team, you can can have a huge impact on our solution and the success of cryptocurrencies.

PolySign is co-founded by Arthur Britto, a co-founder of Ripple. In just five years, Ripple is a recognized leader in payments technology and has been recently recognized by CNBC as the 5th most valuable startup in the United States. Fortune.com has reported Ripple as one of the five hottest fintech companies in the world.  For more information on Ripple, see the Ripple Press Center.

Backend.jobDescription:
Join us, and grow …

In an entrepreneurial culture … producing a Clean Energy product … combining your contributions with those of an experienced team of professionals.

Through a variety of sales channels, WaterFurnace Internationaldesigns, manufactures and distributes geothermal heat pumps that are widely used in single family homes, apartments, schools, hotels, office buildings, and factories, as well as in facilities with special environmental requirements.

WaterFurnace International, Inc., the most respected name in geothermal heat pumps, seeks a Backend Developer to support our various business functions with reliable, cutting-edge joint platform of Information Technology services.

  



About NIBE


NIBE, the parent company of WaterFurnace, is forming a global task force with the mission to develop the next generation of connected solutions for indoor climate.  

Do you have what it takes to join the team of brilliant minds and accelerate the path towards a more sustainable future? 

NIBE is the global leader within indoor climate solutions with minimum impact on the environment. Our solutions for heating, cooling, ventilation and hot water clearly play an important part of building a more sustainable future.  Years of innovation and growth have taken us to where we are now, and it is time to take the next leap in our development. Digitalization and connectivity unlock new opportunities for even more sustainable energy production and improved solutions for indoor climate.  

We have formed a unique joint platform initiative with the purpose of creating separate, jointly-led development teams located in different areas of the world. It will serve the entire group of companies within NIBE Climate Solutions, spanning several markets with a new platform for Internet of Things and Smart Home Systems. We are calling for the brightest minds who share our commitment to work for a more sustainable future—so that, together, we can push the boundaries of how to utilize local energy sources in the most efficient ways possible to create a comfortable indoor climate. 

Description
 


You will be a part of a small team responsible for developing the SQL and NoSQL backend system in a multi datacenter cluster with the addition of a hybrid cloud system. 

NIBE has developing units in many locations around the world; your assignments will be for both European and North American customers. 

You will be a part of a development team with multiple nationalities consisting of ~20 people with expertise in many areas ranging from hardware development to cloud services.  

 

Qualifications
 


Skills required:  

2+ years of C# software development experience. 


In-depth knowledge of different SQL databases. 


Good English speaking and writing communication skills.


High School diploma or GED 

Skills preferred: 


API development and Message queuing services such as RabbitMQ.


Experience with MongoDB, Cassandra or similar NoSQL databases… 


Proficiency with VMWare, Hyper-V and Azure  


Linux system experience 


Proficiency with revision control including: git, subversion, or equivalent


 

For consideration, please apply via our website.

Your benefits will include Group Health Insurance, including Medical, Dental, Prescription, Vision, and Flexible Spending Account; Company-Paid Group Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment; Short- and Long-Term Disability; Vacation; paid Sick/Personal days; Holidays; and 401(k) Retirement Savings with Company Match.

WaterFurnace's Fort Wayne-based headquarters serves as a model for commercial geothermal installations worldwide.  Our innovative approach, state-of-the-art business systems and outstanding work environment combine to make WaterFurnace your Employer of Choice.

WaterFurnace International, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Backend.jobDescription:
Job Requisition Number: 62613 

The Role: 


Bloomberg's Structured Products group is looking for developers to fill various roles within our department. We have teams that build applications, process and curate data, develop infrastructure, and create predictive models. 




Our interview process is dynamic, and our assessment of your abilities and experience will drive where you are placed in one of our teams. It is most important that you demonstrate a capacity to learn and ability to think on your feet during the interview process. 



Qualifications: 
 1+ years of professional software Development experience 

 BS in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Physics, or other related field 

 Working knowledge in a scripting (Python, Javascript, Ruby, etc.) or compiled language (Java, C++) 

 Experience in Python and Linux a plus 




Although our teams primarily work in Python and C++, experience in these languages is not a requirement. You will be challenged to find the appropriate technology and tools to fit the problem. 


While knowledge of Structured Products or other financial concepts is not required, candidates are expected to have a strong desire to learn the domain. We expect to train new developers in the concepts underlying Structured Products. 




Candidates are expected to be excellent communicators, work independently, take personal responsibility for the success of their projects, and drive them forward with initiative and determination. 



The Company: 


Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world. 

 
  

Date:  Tue, 10 10 2017 00:00:00 GMT 
Department:  Software Developer/Engineering

 Summary 

 
Gaia Interactive is building a new product which allows mass  audience to hang out in a virtual space to chat, share media, and play  games. We re looking for a highly experienced Backend Engineer/System  Architect who is excited to design and build complex backend systems.
 
The position will involve architecting and building scalable,  event-driven system for supporting a virtual world and community.

&nbsp


 
 Requirements

Backend.jobDescription:
At myDevices, we are passionate about building software for the Internet of Things. We are looking for a talented Backend Engineer to join our amazing team. As a Senior Backend Engineer at myDevices you will help architect and build the business logic, backbone services and scalable systems for our IoT platform. In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on both architecture and direction.

If you’re a passionate, professional software engineer who enjoys doing things the right way, we want to hear from you! 

Position Responsibilities

Architect and build the myDevices back-end working with cloud engineering and front end team to produce a world-class service
Work with engineers to build microservice architecture, scalable systems and for continued development
Contribute to the development of our IoT platform’s components such as storage, messaging, analytics, deployment and testing
As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed
Mentor and teach more junior developers

Requirements

BS or MS in Computer Science
Minimum 5 years of experience in software development
Designing and implementing APIs and core services in NodeJS, Elixir, or Go
Possess strong leadership skills and professionalism to be a technical mentor within our team
Experience architecting fault-tolerant and scalable services
Be a team player of an autonomous, cross-functional agile remote team
Experience in multi-threaded programming and distributed systems
Work in a test driven development
Strong communication and organizational skills
Proven ability to balance multiple priorities and communicate across organizational boundaries

Bonus Qualification

Experience with Docker containers along with Kubernetes
Knowledge of big data analytics and stream processing (Hadoop, Storm, Spark, Samsa, etc.)
Familiarity with MQTT, CoAP, LoRa
Experience with at least one of these data messaging stream (Kafka, Flume, Kinesis, ActiveMQ, or RabbitMQ)
Experience with deployment and maintenance of Redis, Kafka, ElasticSearch, Cassandra and other NoSQL solutions
Past experience with cloud deployments (AWS, GCP, Azure, Raskspace, etc.)
Love and passion for IoT

Our Perks
 This role provides high growth and visibility potential. Be a key part of the team building the IoT platform for the connected world of today. We will provide the equipment of your choosing, opportunity to work with all the latest and greatest connected things, great compensation, generous health benefits, 401K and FSA programs, team lunches, snacks and paid vacation. 

Are you up for the challenge?
 Send us your application via the application form
. 

Visit mydevices.com
for more information about our company. 

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Backend.jobDescription:
Senior Back-End Developer


Salary - commensurate with experience
Must be authorized to work in U.S. without sponsorship
Who we are looking for:


MarketOnce is searching for a highly driven back-end developer who is committed to excellence.  We are not concerned with your previous language experience, however you must be willing and able to dive deep into C#.  You will be focused on architecting and coding bulletproof production applications in a collaborative environment, and will be expected to lead and mentor a team of 1-7 developers while doing so.

Who we are:


MarketOnce is a product company that is working on building a new sales and marketing automation platform.  We have a clear vision and goals to accomplish this feat and we are looking for driven, like-minded people to help us get there.

MarketOnce consists of around 20 people (devs, designer, tester, DBA) that care about each other and our work.  We are a tight-knit, work-family that live through our core values and fight in the trenches together every day. The team never hesitates to help each other. Although we are all very different people, we are tied together by a common goal of excellence and growth.  In that pursuit, you will have a lot of responsibility and be expected to contribute every single day.  We look forward to meeting you and having you share a little bit of who you are with us.

The position entails:

Writing code in C#, architecture work, and collaborating with teammates
Leading a team of 1-7 developers to hit agreed-upon deadlines
Reporting to the Director of Software Engineering
Learning the sales and marketing industries
Creating bulletproof, long-living, production applications
Mentoring your dev team through code reviews
Participating in our Professional Development Program for self-improvement
Interviewing potential candidates
Ensuring technical implementations align with the technology vision/roadmap
Determining appropriate technology strategy for a single project and overseeing the evolution of its codebase
Participating in requirements gathering
Supporting the Project Manager in project planning
Defining deliverables/deadlines on your project
Culture building
Being a steward of our Software Development Life-Cycle

Knowledge and skill requirements:

Deep experience with two or more software languages, REST, source control, and testing
Experience with database technologies, hosting environments, SOA, IT, networking, system design/architecture, and Software Development Methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, RUP)
Experience in a leadership role
Highly skilled in OOP
Highly skilled in software estimation
Highly skilled in automated unit and integration testing
Familiarity with common software/application design patterns
Understanding of enterprise integration patterns

Knowledge and skills that would help you stand out:

Experience in Digital Marketing
Expert in .NET, C#, and SQL Server
Knowledge of functional programming
Expert in VMWare, Hyper-V, and Docker
NoSQL experience (Hadoop, Cassandra, HBase, Mongo, etc.)
Designing highly-scalable applications and databases

Other expectations:

You live our Core Values
You have a wide range of interest in the technology world
You have demonstrated enthusiasm for people and software development
You are often learning new skills, quickly
You are open to reviewing code and having your code reviewed
No excuses, no drama, no BS

What are our core values?


Reliable


“Reliability is the foundation to strong relationships.”
We hold ourselves accountable and can always be trusted to deliver on our commitments.
We are responsive and easily accessible.
We are honest and willing to say no.

Thoughtful


“Our thoughtfulness drives optimal, intentional results.”
We believe thoughtfulness fosters deeper relationships and minimizes unintended consequences.
We take full and deep consideration of how we affect the people around us and the potential impact of our decisions and actions.

Pragmatic


“Optimal outcomes are achieved by respecting real-world constraints.”
When knowledge is rooted in practice, results are higher quality and more predictable.
We break down situations to their essence and apply our practical experience to create common-sense solutions.

Team-Oriented


“We accomplish more as a team.”
We communicate openly and collaborate effectively.
We rely on each other's strengths and empower each other with empathy and encouragement.
We commit to supporting team members through any challenges they may face. We learn and grow together.

Continuously Improving


“We strive to become the best versions of ourselves.”
We are forever learners that grow through our successes and mistakes.
We are not only open to feedback, but we seek it out.
Our humility opens us up to learn from everyone.

Driven


“Good enough isn’t good enough.”
We always strive to go above and beyond, even when no one is looking.
We are constantly seeking new challenges.
No matter what we're doing, we're giving it 100%.

Backend.jobDescription:
Job Description: Full-Stack Software Engineer 

 Department: Enterprise Software 


 Location: Minnetonka, Minnesota 


 ABOUT PEOPLENET: 


 PeopleNet is a technology leader in the Transportation, Logistics, and Energy industry with a long history of innovation spanning software, hardware, and wireless communications. Our feature-rich enterprise solution uses the latest technology such as M2M communications hosted in the cloud. Our technology connects in-cab intelligent displays and on-board computers to customer back-end systems using RESTful APIs. 


 ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY: 


 At PeopleNet we are passionate about our people, our customers, our culture, and especially our technology. Here you can be a part of a development team utilizing bleeding edge technologies to tackle complex challenges. This is an exceptional opportunity to make a real difference in a self-empowered and agile organization that encourages new ideas through collaboration and creativity. Come join us and help us build the technology that will define the future of fleet mobility solutions. 


 RESPONSIBILITIES: 

 * Stay on top of new and up-and-coming technologies 

 * Be an educator and a mentor for junior engineers 

 * Possess intellectual humility - Be able to make mistakes and learn from them 

 * Design and build sophisticated and highly-scalable systems 

 * Challenge everything - Push yourself and others by asking how we can be better in all aspects of our work 

 * Ensure the team's work is of high quality through the use of best practices such as continuous integration, unit and integration testing, and code reviews 

 * Take ownership and lead development of team objectives 

 * Collaborate in a culture that promotes passion in technology 

 * Hack away at the bleeding edge of technology during our epic Hack-a-thons (and win a cool prize like a Super Star Destroyer Lego set!) 


 REQUIRED SKILLS: 

 * 2-year degree or equivalent experience in a software related field 

 * 2+ years of experience developing scalable full-stack solutions 

 * Demonstrate one or more specific successes from current or past technical challenges 

 * Experience with Java/Groovy or other JVM technologies 

 * Experience with Spring Framework 

 * Experience with database technologies such as SQL or NoSQL 

 * Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS 

 * Experience with single page application frameworks such as AngularJS 


 * Experience with backend unit testing tools such as JUnit, Mockito, Cucumber, or Spock 

 * Experience with frontend unit testing tools such as Mocha, Jasmine, or Karma 


 PREFERED SKILLS: 

 * Experience with any of the following is a plus: 

 + Micro Service architecture 

 + REST APIs 

 + Spring Boot 

 + Specific databases such as Cassandra and ElasticSearch 

 + Messaging brokers such as Kafka and RabbitMQ 

 + Angular Material (Material Design) 

 + ES2015/ES6 (Babel) 

 + HTML5 and CSS pre-processors such as SASS or LESS 

 + Front-end build tools such as Grunt, Gulp, Browserify, or Webpack 

 + Building NodeJS services 

 + Amazon Web Services (AWS) 

 + Source control such as Git/GitHub 


 All candidates must show proof of eligibility to work in the United States. E.O.E./M/F/H/V

ManTech is seeking an experience Java Developer-Back End to     join the ATS-L project as a collaborative team member in support of ongoing law enforcement   enterprise   search applications. The right candidate will bring an interest in applying his or her talents to national and homeland security problems.      

The Java Developer-Back End will: 

  • Use Java, SQL and Oracle to design, develop, test and maintain data services (SOAP/REST).         Write client services utilizing an enterprise search RESTful service. 
  • Work with customers and team members in an agile development environment. Solve highly technical software development issues. 

• Follow Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) best practices for code build and deployments 

• Present the solution at formal and informal design reviews, and document the design according to the Government’s system lifecycle methodology    
 Minimum Requirements:   
  ·        BS Degree in a related technical fields ( Computer Science, Engineering, etc)      
  ·       5+ years of    strong     Java J2EE/JEE design and software development experience including designing, programming, and documenting large-scale software systems      
  ·        Demonstrated expertise with Java, Java Frameworks (Spring, JMS), Object-Oriented Design and development principles; and Java Application Servers such as WebLogic or Apache Tomcat; and relational databases such as Oracle or DB2

  ·        Demonstrated expertise in software engineering practices (e.g., reading/generating software specs, design patterns, continuous integration)      
  ·        Service Oriented Architecture design and development experience     
  ·       Must meet the US Citizenship requirement and be able to obtain and maintain a Customs Border Protection Background Investigation 
 
    
  Preferred Experience and Skills    
  ·       Experience with Enterprise Search Technologies (Solr, Elasticsearch,    Lucene,     or others)     
  ·        First-hand experience working with large project teams or working with the Federal Government     
  ·        Prior experience with Caching, Clustering, Distributed Computing

Backend.skills: Kafka, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing Scala, Python, and Golang for data processing and analytics Cloud infrastructure based on AWS
Backend.jobDescription:
About JASK
 JASK was founded in 2016 and is headed by industry leaders with decades of experience solving real-world SOC issues. With a mission to address the security gaps that restrict security modernization efforts, JASK’s world-class engineering and data science teams apply decades of hands-on experience to drive advancements in autonomous SOC technology. Backed by Battery Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank, JASK is modernizing SOC operations for companies across the financial services, telecommunications, healthcare and government industries. OVERVIEW
 The mission of a Senior Software Engineer is to design and build capabilities that let users visualize and interact with their data to meet their analytical needs. To achieve that mission, Senior Software Engineers are involved in all stages of the product development and deployment lifecycle: idea generation, user interviews, planning, design, prototyping, execution, shipping, and iteration. You might spend one day interviewing users to suss out the questions they need to ask of their data and the next brainstorming mockups with Product Designers. Then it's time to take on the hard technical problems: figuring out how to make it possible for a user to explore the full range of data, at vast scale, then dive deep to understand each data point at a granular level.
 
Technologies We UseKafka, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing
Scala, Python, and Golang for data processing and analytics
Cloud infrastructure based on AWS
What We ValueStrong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Golang, Python, SCALA or similar languages.
Ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.
Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.

 
WHY JASK
 JASK hires the best and expects the best.  With a leadership team built from expertise solving real-world SOC issues, savvy data scientists and engineers with a long-term vision for risk mitigation and an entrepreneurial culture, JASK is changing the game. We are set to transform the way the SOC analyst tackles protecting corporate risk. With offices located in San Francisco and Austin, Texas, we’re positioned to hire the brightest minds.  Visit JASK.AI to learn more!

Are you a Developer that thrives on solving difficult problems at scale? Can you be given a challenge, some restrictions and come up with a creative solution to meet complex business requirements? Do you want to work with a collaborative and driven team of Developers who share the same passion? If so, the LAMPS PLUS Web Development team could be a great fit!

OUR STACK:


Back End

Front End:
 Multiple client and internal facing web-based applications utilizing HTML5, SCSS, Vanilla JS, Babel, jQuery, Backbone, Marionette, React, and Redux.

Infrastructure:
 Full Continuous Integration build process with aspirations to move to a full Continuous Delivery pipeline. Perforce and GIT/BitBucket source control. Full Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, Fisheye/Crucible, Stride) for task management, documentation, code review, and chat.

Regular job attendance is required in accordance with a regular schedule established for the position by the supervisor.

Join our winning team!

We offer a competitive wage and benefits package including 401k with employer matching contribution, generous employee discounts and much more.

To apply, send your resume online.

Lamps Plus is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Backend.skills: Algorithms, Automated, Cisco, Configuration Management, Development, Java, Linux, Management, Programming, Python, QA, Software Engineer, VM, VMware
Backend.jobDescription:
What You'll Do 

You will design, develop, test, and debug state of the art software modules for the management plane. These software modules allow a user to provision configuration and manage Cisco HyperFlex, a highly scalable distributed system of next generation hyperconverged nodes and services. These software modules and sub-systems will run on-premise and in the cloud for managing a large number of Cisco HyperFlex nodes and services.  


As a member of an engineering team, you will design and implement innovative software, and deliver comprehensive automated tests to ensure high quality software development. You will debug and fix defects, and deliver a high performance and high-quality software product.  

Who You'll Work With 
 You will work with product management on writing detailed functional specifications for the features. You will work with various management plane engineering and data plane engineering teams to integrate your software modules into the product. You will work with QA on test plans, and on defect fixing. You will work with product support to interface with customers using your product. You will collaborate with other members of your team and cross-functional team to develop and integrate your components, and enhance your expertise as a systems software engineer. 

Who You Are 


You have 5+ years of experience in design and development of scalable,distributed management and virtual infrastructure management software modules in a Linux environment.  


You are a hands-on engineer with a passion for programming and data structures, and proficiency in Java, GOLang and/or Scala (or any similar functional programming language). You also have strong scripting skills in Python.  


In addition, following skills are highly desirable:  

      Naturally think of APIs, or RESTful APIs to enable automation 
         Experience in implementing algorithms for large-scale system configuration,     system upgrades, monitoring & provisioning in a distributed environment.     
      Working level understanding to advanced level experience in virtualization technologies like VMWare, Hyper-V, KVM including knowledge of OVF tools and VM templates. 
         Experience with, or a keen desire to learn and use, 
                              - DevOps configuration management tools like Ansible, SaltStack, Puppet and Chef. 

                              - Containerizing applications like Docker, Kubernetes. 


  Why Cisco 



We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.  


We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.  


We Are Cisco.  


*LI-PC1

Backend.jobDescription:
Java / Backend Developer

 
I'm looking for a Back-End Web Developer who will be responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well. 
Characteristics my client seeks:
• You are informed about the latest backend technologies and strive to be on the up and up with the latest tech.
• When developing, you are a critical part of the team to ensure information is processed efficiently, accurately stored, and presented in an informative way.
• Your work is well organized and easily digestible by team members.
• You want to be part of something much bigger than yourself.
 
You Do

As a member of the backend development team, you will be tasked with taking wireframes and requirements documents from the UX team and be responsible for implementing the backend using the best backend technologies and making the right choices based on timeline and budgetary constraints. You will offer up elegant solutions to difficult or challenging problems. As an experienced backend developer you are able to help advise and trouble shoot issues with other members of our team.
Tech Skills Needed
You live and breathe software and although you prefer open source tech like Java, Python and PostgreSQL, you kinda dig what Microsoft has been up to lately.
IntelliJ rocks but you also spend a lot of time at the command line.
 
You Bring

• 3+ years backend experience including modern Java in a professional environment
• An interest in working on high-end CMS projects
• Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with clients, our sales team, designers and developers
• A positive attitude
• Ability to work on multiple projects
• A desire to lead people and make technology choices
• A sense of urgency
 
You Get

 Competitive salary
Full benefits
SIMPLE IRA matching
Paid holidays and vacation

Backend.skills: Python, Java, C++, SQL, NoSQL Microservices, Architecture, Back-End, Backend, Back end, Systems Test, Unit Test, Integration Test, Web, Mobile, Bank, Pay, Fintech, Security, Crypto, Currency
Backend.jobDescription:
As a Senior Backend Engineer you will help architect and build the business logic and backbone services for our crypto-currency platform. You will build central services such as the account, firm, and vault managers that form the backbone of our system, and connect them to our front end systems which include web and mobile platforms.
In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on both architecture and direction. You will interface with and assist the front end and cloud services teams to help launch our platform.
What you’ll do:
• Architect and build the back end working with cloud services team, and front end team to produce a world-class fintech service 
• Build quality in, delivering significant unit, integration and system tests along with your code 
• Write developer documentation, reference implementations, and other educational content as needed 
• As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed
What we are looking for:
We’re looking for passionate, professional software engineers who enjoy doing things the right way. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of python and the python ecosystem, as well as code security, scalability, quality and sustainability. Deep experience with another language, like C++ or Java, will be very useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position. As a software professional, you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members and teams.
Required Skills:
• At least 5 years experience building enterprise grade software using python and related technologies. Deep knowledge of python and python libraries. 
• Deep experience with a second language like C++ or Java 
• Extensive experience with: 
• Object oriented concepts and design patterns 
• Unit and system testing 
• Software security concepts and best practices 
• Experience with: 
• Conceiving, developing and vetting new software architectures 
• Microservice architectures 
• SQL and NoSQL 
• Track record of writing high quality, sustainable, testable, performant code using best software development practices 
• Strong sense of software craftsmanship, professionalism and responsibility 
• Understanding of Agile estimating and planning methods, and a record of estimating and delivering to schedule 
• BS in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience
Bonus Skills:
• Knowledge of Javascript and modern javascript user interface libraries such as React 
• Experience with mobile development using React Native 
• Experience with electronic financial exchanges and markets 
• Experience with cryptography, particularly digital currency
Key Technologies:
• Front End: Javascript, React and React Native 
• Backend: Python, Node, C++, postgresql, websockets, ZeroMQ, Docker 
• OS: Linux
What we offer:
• The opportunity to join a well-funded, cutting edge financial technology company at a very early stage 
• Competitive salary and equity 
• Competitive medical benefits 
• Generous 401K matching plan 
• Flexible working policies: work with your manager to determine the best combination of work at office/work from home arrangements 
• A software culture that values quality, sustainability and craftsmanship over time to market 
• Smart co-workers who are world class experts in the field of crypto-currency 
• A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
Who we are:
We are a stealth mode startup in the San Francisco Bay Area working in the area of institutional custody for cryptocurrencies. Our solution will be a key component to the mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies. Cryptocurrencies are an exciting emerging market with considerable opportunities for success. As member of a small, world class technical team, you can can have a huge impact on our solution and the success of cryptocurrencies

Title: Java BackEnd Developer

Location: San Jose

Salary: $130-160K +Benefits

 

Love Software engineering? Have a passion for data? How would you like to join a company that encompasses both of these aspects into your everyday job? Would you like to join a company that has built a SaaS product that enables users to convert the mass of data on websites into structured, machine readable data with no coding required!

We are currently working with a successful start-up based South of the bay that have built a highly efficient and scalable platform which allows users to process 1,000 of URL’s at any given time and gain access to millions of rows of data that they can use for hundreds of different use cases. Interesting huh?

You will be joining a successful start-up who is only at the start of their journey and they are looking to scale up their Backend Team. Your primary focus will be the development of all servicer side logic, definition and maintenance of their service offerings, ensure high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front end. As within any interesting start up you will work well in a collaborative environment, be passionate about coding, architecture and technical innovation!

Backend.jobDescription:
Are you a PHP web development veteran? If the answer is “yes” - then we want you! We have an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to join our eCommerce team and develop websites for some of the fastest growing brands in the apparel industry.

The Senior Backend Developer will have a strong understanding of systems integration with the backend ERP functionality as well as Server Side configuration. They will be able to structure and build out all requirements and identify hurdles for new functionality. The Senior Developer will be involved in meetings w/ the business community in order to understand the requirements from a technical standpoint and build out development needs in order to deliver the project in on time and on budget.

The ideal candidate should also be capable of learning and supporting our Magento Enterprise eCommerce Platform. He/She will work with the business community to outline, design and implement complex and multi-faceted projects. He/She will confirm site objectives and plan web applications by analyzing and validating user requirements and project specifications. It will be essential to focus on streamlining and upgrading existing features, identifying constraints and technical issues. When executing a project the Senior Web Developer will need to estimate projects accurately.

 


What you’ll be doing:

Develop prototypes; build and reuse scalable code; program classes, functions, and scripts to meet requirements with sufficient error handling
Develop web applications, build API’s, databases, and supporting systems on the Magento Enterprise Platform
Develop EDI Magento extensions that integrate with various backend and supplementary systems
Build and maintain databases; ensuring cross-browser/cross-platform compatibility; protecting against common security loopholes
Apply concepts of graceful degradation, progressive enhancement, and unobtrusive scripting
Stay up to date on application programming best practices to utilize site/server resources more efficiently
Document changes and procedures
Lead development team down growth path by example in training, processes, and methodology
Know OOL (Java preferred) with knowledge to design and create a backend application with an OO design.
Knowledge in store procedures and database trigger.
Knowledge of VM and basic server function and maintenance.

 

What you need:


4+ Years experience in the following

Programming Languages: PHP, XML, XHTML, HTML, Ajax, jQuery, OOP (Java preferred)


Web Services – One or more of the following: XML, SOAP, JSON, WSDL, WS-I, XML-RPC


Developing in PHP, JavaScript and JAVA languages


Application development using MySQL


Configuring applications to run on Linux servers with optimal performance


Web interface design with strong XHTML and CSS


Advanced Information Analysis and problem solving


Strong verbal and written communication


 

Reasons to join us:


Excellent growth opportunities


Lucrative Salary Package.


Fun and friendly work environment with hard working great developers


You will play an integral part in working with a very innovative and forward-thinking e-commerce team.

ES6

Senior Backend Software Engineer – Java/Python


 

Location Labs an Avast company is actively recruiting for a Senior Backend Software Engineer as the team is hard at work to bring a groundbreaking new app to the mobile consumer product market, which will enhance the personal safety of children all over the world.

Your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic, API definition, leveraging our Big Data and Machine Learning infrastructure to generate, serve new insights and drive engagement with our customers, optimization of the existing systems, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness that power our flagship mobile apps and various backend services. This position will work closely with product, design, DevOps and the mobile engineering team.

The Senior Software Engineer will help evolve our architecture by building on great technologies like Cloudinary, NewRelic, MapBox, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Branchio, TeamCity, Fabric, Loggly, DataDog, Grafana, Kafka, Riak and more.

and/or Python 
with OOP

ll scripting, Database, data transformation and Cloud-based technologies such as AWS, OpenStack,

.

 including unit tests, quality, 
and performance

 understanding of the full stack and have owned the development, build, testing

You constantly incorporate new and creative

Location Labs is the leader in mobile consumer products that enhance the personal safety of millions of users. Acquired in 2016 by online security leader Avast, our services are used by millions of monthly paying subscribers worldwide. Location Labs is redefining the market with a refreshing take on location services and the way in which mobile devices are managed.

-          5+ years of professional Ruby on Rails software development experience

-          Advanced Back end architectural experience

-          Strong experience with PostgresSQL

-          Advanced experience with AWS cloud infrastructure (S3, EC2, etc.)

-          Experience with NoSQL database such as DynamoDB is a plus!

 

Reasons to Join:

Backend.skills: Python, SQL, PAYMENT GATEWAYS, PostgreSQL, Go
Backend.jobDescription:
Position: Backend Payments Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA

Job Type: Full Time

Skills: Python, SQL, PAYMENT GATEWAYS, PostgreSQL, Go

 

Job Description


As a Backend Payments Engineer your primary objective is to work with API engineers to develop and maintain Omni’s payment infrastructure. You will be expected to work across Python, Go and SQL. You will report directly to the Director of Engineering.

Prerequisites for this position entail: 


- Exhibited core competency in creating payment solutions, especially those used by online marketplaces 

- Experience with major payment gateways, such as Braintree, PayPal and BitPay 

- Past work interfacing with APIs, especially in Go and/or Python 

- Experience with working on databases in SQL, especially in PostgresQL 

- Understanding of the security and legal best-practices of working with online payments 

- Comfort with cryptocurrency terminology and integrations; preference given to candidates with Ripple Interledger experience. 

- Exhibited competence with Git and associated collaboration workflows.

Core responsibilities and expectations in this role include:


- Creation, improvement, and deployment of future payment systems on the Omni marketplace. 

-Integrations to support cryptocurrency payments on the Omni platform 

- Maintenance and expansion of Omni’s existing billing system.

* Additional expectations for highly qualified individuals in this role include: 

- Willingness to offer IT support for the administrative and support teams 

- Understanding of Agile Development methodologies and associated tooling. 

- Knowledge of containerized software and tooling, such as Docker and ECS. 

- Comfort with popular back-end languages such Python, and/or Go

Are you a Strong Backend Engineer with Java/Scala experience with a desire to work in a mobile startup, please read on!

We are working with mobile app developers to make every single user's in-app experience much better.  The company is founded by an all-star team - we are backed by the creators of Testflight and Parse. 

They plan to take what they've learned around mobile intelligence and monetization and enable app owners to intently focus on every single one of their users by turning the tons of client-side data across all apps (their own and others') into automated and proactive approaches to creating the best user experiences possible. (Think lots of data, deep segmentation and machine learning, and immediate improvements to in-app experiences.) Goal is to improve mobile apps and drive revenue in ways an app owner couldn't do on their own or, more typically, don't have the time, tools, or skillset to do, especially considering the increasingly fragmented and complex mobile - 3rd party tech, their own tech, device, OS, carrier ... - landscape.

We are very recently well funded by VCs and Angels who own media, games, and eCommerce apps. They are now building a team who love to be an integral part of the mobile eco-system, openly contribute and lead developers, and enjoy pointing out the problems in other folks' apps!

What You Will Be Doing

- You've been a member of a team that built something and are now ready to lead your own effort

- 3+ yrs experience developing data processing applications in Java and/or Scala and running them in production
- Experience using one of the following in a production environment at scale and tuning it for performance: Spark, Storm, Kafka Streaming, Flink

As a Senior Backend Engineer you will help architect and build the business logic and backbone services for the crypto-currency platform. You will build central services such as the account, firm, and vault managers that form the backbone of our system, and connect them to the front end systems which include web and mobile platforms.
In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on both architecture and direction. You will interface with and assist the front end and cloud services teams to help launch our platform.

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of python and the python ecosystem, as well as code security, scalability, quality and sustainability. Deep experience with another language, like C++ or Java, will be very useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position. •Competitive salary and equity
•Competitive medical benefits

Backend.jobDescription:
Cinder is looking for a Back-End Insights Engineer to fill a role for our clients in Lake Oswego, OR. This is a full time, 40 hour per week opportunity with a full benefits package that includes PTO! 

 We've got our eye out for a developer who is eager to solve problems, collaborate with team members, and work in a DevOps-supported, continuous deployment environment. We are looking for candidates who have a deep knowledge of multiple programming languages, particularly those that comprise our stack: Python, Go and JavaScript. Ideally, you are a fellow Pythonista/Gopher who has a passion for clean, well-tested and expressive code. 

 Currently, we are seeking someone who can dive into our Python codebase managed by our "Insights" guild, which helps bridge the gap between our Data Sciences and Engineering teams. Our teams work to build new services & features in modern apps using experience gained from previously developed legacy apps. We practice collaboration, UX prototyping, test-driven CI, and pull request code reviews (ticket tracking, acceptance testing, etc.) to produce high-quality code and continue to learn and improve the system 

 Job Duties may include but are not limited to: 

 * Contribute ideas, research, and knowledge to the team to increase skills for self and the team at large 

 * Develop programmatic solutions to business problems and ability to automate business processes 

 * Take ownership of functionality from development through deployment. 

 * Be ready to learn new languages, tools, and systems quickly, and be able to communicate challenges and ask for help regularly 

 * Deploy quality code, write tests, and learn from mistakes to build a better system and improve your skills 

 * Work with Product Owners, Business Analysts and other Developers to estimate, size, and scope of work 

Required Skills:   

 * 3+ years experience in Python, Go and Javascript application development. 

 * Bachelor's degree in computer science, math or related STEM fields; relevant experience, especially focused in Go development, may be substituted 

 * 5+ years working in a team environment as a programmer, preferably in a back-end role 

 * Ability to learn and understand the media buying process and business goals in order to develop intelligent solutions for users and clients 

 * Experience using distributed code repositories (git, Mercurial) in a team environment or a large open source project 

 * Prior experience supporting multiple browsers, operating systems and devices 

Preferred Skills:   

 * Experience in Ruby, MySQL or frameworks like React. 

 * Prior development on a service-oriented / microservice architecture 

 * Prior development of REST APIs 

 * Prior experience with Python frameworks like Flask or aiohttp 

 * Prior experience with PostgreSQL, PostGIS and Elasticsearch 

 * Prior experience with Mapbox GL JS or similar map rendering tech 

 * Established gibhub account with coding examples/projects 

Work Environment:   

 * Job Location: Must be done onsite 

 * Shift: Normal business hours 

 If you are looking for a professional, challenging, stimulating environment and meet the above criteria, please apply now!! 

 US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. No third party candidates considered for this position. 

 Cinder is a rapidly growing consulting firm based in Beaverton, OR. We are bringing a new perspective to the staffing industry, providing a better experience for both customers and employees. Our collaborative company culture and positive work environment are a refreshing alternative to traditional staffing firms! Backend.jobDescription:
Robert Half Technology is seeking a back-end C# developer for an industry leader based in Cincinnati, OH. This role is direct-hire. 

The C# developer produces or modifies computer programs of all sizes and complexity. Solves systems and program problems. Recommends courses of action on new application jobs, while considering the total system spectrum, from source document origination to final systems output and handling. Handles extensive research, analysis, definition and documentation on all facets of the job. Recommends the appropriate hardware solution (Personal Computer, LAN, Mainframe, Client Server, etc.) for the application. Provides mentoring support for less experienced programming staff. Works with minimal supervision and is responsible for making an established range of decisions, escalating to Manager when necessary and updating Manager on a regular basis. 


Position Responsibilities: 


Researches, designs, defines, develops, tests, documents and implements new computer applications or changes to existing applications. 

Installs software packages and/or personal computer software. 

Assures that hardware and software operate efficiently. 

Utilizes programming tools effectively to ensure accuracy and enhance productivity. 

Assembles and analyzes data relating to processing problems, soliciting help as needed from IT and business unit associates.

Backend.jobDescription:
Our client is the developer of a financial planning software which is designed for financial advisors. As an industry leader in innovation, we believe in providing advisors software that is smart, easy and adaptable to create friendly and meaningful goal-based financial plans for their clients. Software is used by thousands of financial service professionals from small-size planning firms to large financial institutions. They strive daily to create great software and provide superior customer support to our users. For the past five years, our client has been recognized in Financial Planning Magazine as the #1 software of choice among financial advisors.

 As a member of the Development team, you will be involved in all aspects of internet software development - from design and coding through to testing and implementation on our production sites. Working for a small company affords the opportunity to work not only with front-end development, but also back-end and client-side development, plus architectural and algorithmic problems in between. Hands-off management allows you the freedom and flexibility to accomplish your goals while working independently and as part of a team under the direction of a Senior Developer.

 Successful candidates will have a thirst and passion for software development and learning new technologies. B.S. degree in Computer Science with at least 3 years of coding experience and a strong knowledge of .NET and C# required.

 Team-player attitude and willingness to take initiative and project ownership is a must.

 

Core technologies and tools used:   C#, ASP.Net MVC, SQL Server, JavaScript, NHibernate.

 Additionally, knowledge of investment theories and formulas, or experience with mathematical and statistical programming is a plus.

* Excellent communication & collaborative skills - must be able to work as part of a team and collaborate effectively with your peers.

* Experience with Tableau and Tableau Server preferred. 

* Experience with Microsoft Azure Cloud Computing platform preferred.

Backend.jobDescription:
Job Title: Staff Software Engineer-Back-end
Duration: 6+ months
Location: Sunnyvale CA
The Operations Platform Dev Engineering Group at client owns the principal back-end component sub-systems responsible for the day-to-day mission-critical business operations. 
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Platform team, you will play a pivotal role in the design and development of a platform that delivers mission-critical decisions on the investment advice for millions of Americans.  
You will join a fast-paced core team that works together to design and build services, APIs, and define the data model for this platform. You will work cross-functionally to solve business problems and implement the next-generation design of the platform on the AWS Cloud. 
The ideal candidate will be excited for the challenge to transform and think critically on many computer science disciplines including product design, usability, building APIs, scaling performance, and 24x7 reliability.
Responsibilities:
Design and develop scalable, high performance, and reliable API driven services that operate 24x7.
Implement just-right solution to the problem, applying Big-O principles.
Produce high quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration.
Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity.
Apply your in-depth experience with developing unit tests and functional tests to ensure superior quality product functionality. 
Be a change agent in bringing about technology innovation especially in the realm of developing AWS cloud based micro services
Interact with both business and technical stakeholders to deliver high quality products and services that meets/exceeds business, customer, and technical requirements.
Qualifications:
8+ years of industry experience building and running high performance enterprise applications
Hands on experience developing Java web applications built with modern standards based APIs including ReSTful APIs and Back End implementations. 
Expert skillset in Java language APIs, Spring technologies, Hibernate, JDBC, RDBMS and NoSQL based data persistence
Experience developing solutions on AWS Cloud leveraging AWS Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Cloud Formation, and other related AWS technologies. 
Solid understanding of Domain Modeling with Relational and Non-Relational Databases
Automation driven mindset including monitoring, reporting, iterating, and CI/CD practices
Excellent debugging and problem solving skills, including ability to diagnose and fix performance and scalability issues.
BS in Computer Science or a related field
Pluses:
DevOps experience owning code in production and proactively building qualitative solutions.
Certified AWS Developer or Solution Architect Associate.
Good understanding of investment management & financial economics:  Modern portfolio theory, multi-factor models, style analysis.
Domain knowledge of financial services:  Defined Contribution plans (401(k), 403b, etc), Individual retirement plans (IRA, Roth IRA), and Defined Benefit plans.

 

This is a great opportunity and if you have any interest in hearing more of the details please contact Aditya
 on 703-230-2626
 and/or adityad@idexcel.com

Amazon Web Services / AWS, Devops, NODE, Docker, CI / CD Pipeline, Cloud Deployment Architecture, Application Back-End Scaling, Jenkins, AWS

Are you interested in working with the latest DevOps tools - that will make your life as an engineer better? 
Do you want to help build tools to deploy code and manage / automate infrastructure that can make sense of tons of distributed data?
Do you want to help consumers by providing highly accurate and real-time solutions? If so - we might be a match!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. Get in at the right time with a market leading company that's not just a leader but also a multi-time winner  
2. Track, Record, Analyze and store hundreds of thousand of data points in real-time
3. Create tools that notify and alert users on how to improve their personal ability to deliver the right message at the right time

What You Will Be Doing

Participating as an active member of the DevOps team and contributing to building our cloud infrastructure, management and cloud deployment platform as part of our DevOps team. We also have lots of redundancies that need to be researched and rebuilt for performance and optimization.

Involvement in design, architecture and implementation of best practices for a highly scalable platform that's already processing hundreds of millions of requests per day. 

Using Docker and Amazon Cloud Architecture that will best utilize our existing technology patents to serve real time needs in different lines of consumer lending - think credit cards, auto loans, home loans and anything else you can think of in that space

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience in DevOps and knowledge of:

- AWS We have so much AWS we need folks who are very familiar w/ the stack
- NodeJS - Most of our services are written in NodeJS, so experience with Node, Socket.IO, etc is a huge plus
- Strong Open Source Tools Experience
- We work heavily w/ MongoDB and CouchDB
- Any other modern server language is a big plus!

What's In It for You

Super fun and collaborative work environment! 
Work with a very modern enterprise devops architecture  
Work with an established team that has already a number of successful ventures under their beltSo, if you are a DevOps or Cloud Systems engineer with Docker and AWS experience-  please apply today!

Backend.skills: python django rails saas data modelling etl kafka cassandra
Backend.jobDescription:
This person should expect to have a heavy coding responsibility, we're not looking for the kind of architect who draws a bunch of theoretical diagrams and then hands that off to engineers.
Specific stack isn't the most important consideration for this role, but we would like to see someone who has experience with 'data intensive applications.' That is, an application where the data is the product, not a side-effect of the product.
Typically, this person might have experience with Kafka, Cassandra, ElasticSearch, Spark, microservices, message-passing, event logs, ETL, Domain Driven Design, lambda architecture, kappa architecture, CQRS pattern, graph databases.
Also, experience with data modelling for analytics and social media data is helpful. Someone who has experience leading a refactor for a legacy system would be outstanding.
We're looking for Python as pretty much a must-have and Scala as a big plus. Django experience will help a lot, but some Web Framework is necessary (Django, Flask, Spring/Hibernate, Play, Rails etc) and SaaS/Web app experience is really important here.

In this role, you'll be working to design, build and develop a new server with the right database architecture. If you consider yourself an authority on writing SQL code and love developing new systems, this may be the position for you. 


What you get to do every single day: 

 Design, code, and implement a SQL server for database management 

 Generate a database schema based on application related function and type of the data  

 Import existing data into the database 

 Build a method for storing future database data 

 Ensure internal quality control of data imported and ongoing analysis of data integrity 

 Ensure security and integrity of the database including scheduled backups 

 Provide documentation and training to database administrator. Provide training to other users as necessary 


What you bring to the role: 

 B.S degree or above in computer science or engineering with 2+ years working as a database developer or a related role 

 Strong SQL expertise. You can write a query to do almost anything 

 Knowledge and know-how to fix potential issues, and experience with industry standards for database operations

Backend.jobDescription:
Our client is seeking a   Senior   Backend Developer, Communication Applications  . 
  
Location:   New York, NY 
Position Type:   Full Time 
  
-Our client’s   data moves global financial markets – but only when people can converse about that data.  
-  The Communication Channels team builds the robust infrastructure responsible for delivering real time communications between the 350,000 financial professionals on the Professional Service. 
-  Our software and hard  ware are responsible for processing 700 million instant messages and emails each day.  
-  Stock quotes, trade confirmations, breaking news alerts, and help desk inquiries all flow through our tightly-integrated communication applications, placing our team at the center of the   company   universe. 
-  Every single day we’re tasked with selecting and implementing the best possible solutions to support our clients across every imaginable workflow, geographic location, and asset class.  
-  The Communication Channels group’s products seamlessly link the myriad financial and data application on the Professional Service, making us crucial to the company’s success. 
  
What’s in it for you: 
-  You’ll take ownership over problems and systems you encounter and build your network with our team of friendly, enthusiastic software developers and be responsible for the numerous subsystems that comprise a complete communication application suite, including full-content search, file and attachment management, compliance solutions, and integration with other applications built inside and outside of the company. 
-  Your collaboration with our product managers and different engineering teams will ensure that you understand how your software fits in the bigger picture. 
  
We’ll trust you to: 
-  Strategize with our business sponsors and front end teams to build scalable, performant infrastructure to support new features and technologies. 
-  Demonstrate ownership over vast infrastructure responsible for our clients’ daily workflows and the company’s day-to-day operations. 
-  Promote the use of the best technology for a given problem – be it in-house, commercial, or open source software. 
-  Mentor and be mentored by your colleagues who have different areas of expertise and experience in software systems engineering. 
-  Aggressively roll out new features to be first-to-market while maximizing the stability of our systems. 
  
You’ll need to have: 
-  Experience developing and managing large real-time distributed systems 
-  3 or more years of experience writing software in C++ 
-  3 or more years of experience with object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, and all phases of the SDLC 
  
We’d love to see: 
-  Enthusiasm for full-stack debugging and analytical problem solving 
-  Experience designing distributed systems 
-  Interest or experience in improving deployment and SDLC processes 
-  Experience with Agile software development methodologies

Their eCommerce presence must not only provide shopping access to over 300 million searchable products, highly interactive design tools, and live access to specialists, but also continue to keep pace with the demand for the Internet of Things. You will apply your skills and knowledge in the design, implementation and maintenance of highly scalable software solutions. They are looking for someone who is excited about being a member of the team, and contributing their years of experience to the team’s collective growth and success.

Their team is highly energetic, collaborative, and passionate about their work. They pride themselves on their adherence to Agile development methodologies, resulting in malleable processes that consistently deliver value while minimizing unnecessary meetings and busywork. By sharing responsibilities, Agile team members contribute by exercising their strengths and are always exploring the latest technologies. They’re looking for a team member who wants to work hard, find innovative solutions, learn more about the leading edge of web technology, and see results in real-world applications.

Make a difference

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience using Agile methodologies and tools such as Scrum and JIRA

Experience with enterprise OO design patterns such as the Repository pattern

Backend.jobDescription:
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Back-End

Duration: 6 to 9 months

Location: Sunnyvale, CA



NOTE: W2 only 



The Operations Platform Dev Engineering Group at Financial Engines owns the principal backend component sub-systems responsible for the day-to-day mission-critical business operations.



As a Senior Software Engineer on the Platform team, you will play a pivotal role in the design and development of a platform that delivers mission-critical decisions on the investment advice for millions of Americans. You will join a fast-paced core team that works together to design and build services, APIs, and define the data model for this platform. You will work cross-functionally to solve business problems and implement the next-generation design of the platform on the AWS Cloud.



The ideal candidate will be excited for the challenge to transform and think critically on many computer science disciplines including product design, usability, building APIs, scaling performance, and 24x7 reliability.



Responsibilities:

-------------------

Design and develop scalable, high performance, and reliable API driven services that operate 24x7

Implement just-right solution to the problem, applying Big-O principles

Produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration.

Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity.

Apply your in-depth experience with developing unit tests and functional tests to ensure superior quality product functionality.

Be a change agent in bringing about technology innovation especially in the realm of developing AWS cloud-based micro services

Interact with both business and technical stakeholders to deliver high-quality products and services that meets/exceeds business, customer, and technical requirements.

Qualifications:



4+ years of industry experience building and running high performance enterprise applications

Hands on experience developing Java web applications built with modern standards-based APIs including ReSTful APIs and Back End implementations.

Expert skillset in Java language APIs, Spring technologies, Hibernate, JDBC, RDBMS and NoSQL based data persistence

Experience developing solutions on AWS Cloud leveraging AWS Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Cloud Formation, and other related AWS technologies.

Solid understanding of Domain Modeling with Relational and Non-Relational Databases

Automation driven mindset including monitoring, reporting, iterating, and CI/CD practices

Excellent debugging and problem solving skills, including ability to diagnose and fix performance and scalability issues.

BS in Computer Science or a related field



Pluses:

--------

DevOps experience owning code in production and proactively building qualitative solutions.

Certified AWS Developer or Solution Architect Associate.



Good understanding of investment management  financial economics: Modern portfolio theory, multi-factor models, style analysis.



Domain knowledge of financial services: Defined Contribution plans (401(k), 403b, etc), Individual retirement plans (IRA, Roth IRA), and Defined Benefit plans.

Backend.jobDescription:
Participate in coding tasks on large projects to stay familiar with the code.  Collaborate with Architecture in Planning stage on architectural design of projects.
Provide development estimates based on the high-level requirements, completing Scope Estimate Template.
Take full ownership of project and iterate with Product Manager until PRD is signed off.
Own product design and documenting design while working with Architect sponsor and cross-functional project team.
Stay abreast of design standards and incorporate into product design.
Identify the need for performance testing early in a project and identify the potential performance impact caused by the new features in the project. Work with load and performance team to ensure impact stays within expected bounds, if needed by doing performance tests earlier in project lifecycle.
Use performance analysis tools as needed to trace performance/resource bottlenecks in project code.
Facilitate code reviews, ensuring they happen in construction phase prior to code complete.
Ensure unit test coverage metrics are met and nightly builds succeed.
Ensure team is performing continuous automated builds and unit testing during development as well as adding/maintaining unit test suite, with the goal of ensuring a high level of code quality as code enters the QA phase.
Manage the project bug queue and ensure QA has a working test environment, resolving issues as necessary.
Work cross-functionally with other department leads to ensure communication and maximum efficiency. - Review other department artifacts such as x-functional estimates, QA Test Plan, PMO Project Plan, and REG deployment plans to ensure efficiencies and cross-team accountability.
Provide work leadership to others, ensuring comprehensive task breakdowns and accurate estimates.
Provide work status to Project and Development Managers and escalates issues on a timely basis, often resolving issues independently.  Work with NOC to resolve post production issues coming from a release expeditiously  

 

Job requirements
: 

Lead medium to large-sized development projects that follow an SDLC methodology.  At least 5 years hands on server-side java/j2ee development experience.  Highly proficient with Java/J2EE (preferably Jboss)  Experience with Spring/Hibernate/ActiveMQ/Oracle  Extensive experience with object-oriented programming  Prefer proven experience developing transactional, eCommerce, hosted web applications  Experience with performance tuning and analysis tools.  Strong communication and teamwork required.
