Backend.jobDescription:
Description 

 Why Carbon Black? 
 
At Carbon Black, you-ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats. 
If you want to join an agile company that-s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it-s no wonder we-ve been named a -Top Place to Work- by the Boston Globe for four consecutive years. Join us! 
Why You Matter 
We are looking for a versatile server backend software engineer to join our Cb Response product development team. Building great software is a team sport. You-ll work closely with UI, other server backend, endpoint, cloud engineering and operations teams, and have frequent opportunity to obtain feedback directly from people who work in the dynamically evolving software security field. 
As a Backend Server Software Engineer, you will be major part of refining and driving forward the newest generation in enterprise endpoint security. This is more than a chance to write amazing code with talented peers. It is a chance to have a huge impact on how thousands of companies and governments visualize and neutralize threats to their networks. This is where global politics meet your code and the people who it empowers. Join us to make something that matters! 
What You-ll Bring 
As a Backend Server Software engineer on Cb Response, you will be heavily involved in the full end-to-end software development life cycle of designing, building, testing and supporting the Cb Response product while helping the team to always push the boundaries of every aspect of what it takes to ship software.  Just to name a few, these aspects include investigating scalability/performance/reliability, improving product-s ability to consume & put away terabytes of data which are streamed in parallel from over 100k endpoints, continuously increasing the quality of the product and teams troubleshooting ability, designing/building new functionality and driving process improvements such as shortening cycle times. 
You will have tons of room to grow, but we have some starting requirements that we want to see in you: 
Requirements/Qualifications: 
3-5 years of experience developing server applications  
Proficient in software development of Python and/or Java applications running on Linux 
Proficient with relational and/or NoSQL database technologies and using them at scale (i.e. to a point where good DB practices, profiling/optimization, hardware constraints, etc. become important considerations) 
Experience in designing/building reliable and scalable server code 
Passion for software development as a craft and ability to thrive in fast-paced environment where the focus is on value delivered, not tasks completed 
Experience with source control management and ticketing systems 
Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies and practices 

Bonus Points: 
B.S./M.S. in Computer Science or related degree 
Even more experience with different database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, KeyValue, Doc, In-Memory, Graph).  The more the better but depth over breadth is preferred. 
Experience with AWS and/or SOLR/Lucene 
Working knowledge of a CI/CD products and practices 
Experience in front-end technologies/frameworks: HTML, CSS, Javascript, React 
Experience with either endpoint or network security, including understanding of how malware interacts with operating systems and communicates over the wire 

Who We Are 



Carbon Black is the leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black-s Next-Generation Antivirus (NGAV) solution, Cb Defense, leverages breakthrough prevention technology, -Streaming Prevention,- to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. Cb Defense uniquely combines breakthrough prevention with market-leading detection and response into a single, lightweight agent delivered through the cloud. With more than 13 million endpoints under management, Carbon Black has more than 3,600 customers, including 30 of the Fortune 100.These customers use Carbon Black to replace legacy antivirus, lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and protect their endpoints from the most advanced cyberattacks, including non-malware attacks.  

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

Back-End Software Developer – CA 
Company: 
 Radiant Logic, Inc. www.radiantlogic.com 
Location: 
 Novato, CA 
Duration: 
 On-going, Full Time  Radiant Logic Introduction 


Radiant Logic is the leader for enterprise-class Federated Identity and context management solutions. Our customers are Fortune 1000 companies; we help them better leverage their existing Identity infrastructure, integrating their businesses to the cloud securely and improving operational productivity. We are a private company, profitable and growing rapidly. The company is led by the founders and their vision and passion are part of every aspect of what we do.  


We are extremely proud of our world-leading technology which simplifies the underlying complexities of integrating disparate systems and lets our customers focus on growing their businesses. All this is enabled by our team of first-class people.  


Our headquarters are in Novato, CA and we have offices in Chicago, Washington DC, and New York.  Role Purpose 


As a Software Developer, you will first learn our products top to bottom, help to extend current software functionality and work to build improved versions of the RadiantOne platform.  Skills and Experience 
BS or MS in CS/CIS or equivalent knowledge/experience 
3 – 5 years of work experience 
Excellent Java skills on the server side 
Good written communication skill 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 
Additional Skills Desired 
Knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load). 
Knowledge of JMS or other publish/subscribe model. 
Knowledge of LDAP directories and SQL databases on Windows or Linux 
Knowledge of identity management concepts and components such as web access control, provisioning, federation, single sign on and meta-directory 
Experience with multi-thread programming 
Knowledge of Active Directory and Oracle Directory Server (formerly Sun Directory) 
Understanding of Enterprise and Unix Security concepts 
Understanding of database algorithms using index methods such as B-tree and Hash 
Knowledge of Web Services, REST Api and Json 
Knowledge of High Availability (HA) clusters and distributed processing a plus 
Experience in HTML5 as applied to client interface a plus 
Knowledge of a Web Access Management packages such as SiteMinder a plus 
Personal profile 


You will be a high-energy, self-starting team player. You will be a proactive learner willing to immerse yourself in learning Radiant Logic technology.  


Radiant Logic is a dynamic, energetic company, where individuals can thrive, be respected for their unique skills and where we push the envelope of what is possible.  Compensation 


The role offers a competitive salary – DOE.

Backend.skills: java ,backend, and financial domain exp must
Backend.jobDescription:
Software Developer 


  Sunnyvale, CA


Position:      Staff Software Backend Engineers


LOA:            6-9 Months, Contract-to-Hire


 

Looking for strong Senior and Staff  Backend Software Engineers with strong Java multithreading, REST/Web Services and MicroServices.  Needs to have  FinTech Domain experience, preferably with Investment Management.

 


Staff Engineer (Back End)


 

We are looking for senior engineers to work in our Engines Applications group. This team is responsible for developing and deliveringAPIs using a domain driven/micro services based architecture that include and interact with the financial algorithms that power Financial Engines’ holistic financial planning services.

The team works closely with other groups within Technology, Financial Research and Product Management.  It collaborates closely with the Financial Research group to investigate and articulate the algorithms and methodologies that form the basis of Financial Engines’ investment and planning services.

We are seeking individuals with demonstrated experience, ability and desire in defining, designing and delivering complex software products.

 

Requirements:


·         5+ years of professional experience.

·         Demonstrated experience with Java and related ecosystem (Spring, Hibernate, Tomcat, etc) or similar.

·         Demonstrated experience with application software integration techniques (REST, SOAP/XML, etc)

·         Expert level understanding of Domain Driven Design and related software architecture and development techniques.

·         Clear demonstrated experience, ability and desire in designing and delivering complex software products.

·         Excellent communication skills.  Individuals on our team work with many different people with very diverse roles and responsibilities.  It is critical that the individual is pro-active in communicating well.

·         Demonstrated experience with leading the definition, design, development and delivery of new product features or components.

·         Experience developing with a test driven approach.

·         Familiarity with or open minded to embrace a dev ops driven culture

 

Duties & Responsibilities:


·         Develop and extend key financial technology and features of our product using Java

·         Develop and maintain Java API’s and REST APIs

·         Define and develop the application and systems architectures for solutions to deep domain engineering problems

·         Lead the collaboration with Financial Research and Product Marketing in analyzing the financial domain requirements

·         Collaborate with Financial Research in investigating and articulating the financial algorithms that drive the forecast, advice, and analysis functionality in Financial Engines’ products

·         Analyze the user experience and develop the algorithms that take the information collected in the user experience and transform them into inputs that are understood by the financial algorithms -- "the models" -- and deliver the end results for other product development teams to utilize.

·         Adept at delivering software in a fast-paced environment while still meeting high fiduciary quality standards.

·         Unit testing and validating financial algorithms and application/domain logic.

 

 


Pluses:


·         Familiarity with investment management & financial economics:  Modern portfolio theory, multi-factor models, style analysis.

·         Domain knowledge of financial services:  Defined Contribution plans (401(k), 403b, etc), Individual retirement plans (IRA, Roth IRA), and Defined Benefit plans.

·         Experience with developing in Amazon AWS

Based in beautiful Salem, New Hampshire we are an innovative , adaptive, and exponentially growing company that specializes in creativity.

If you are interested in joining a cutting edge company that pushes the envelope in the marketing industry and definitely cares about providing a great working environment for its employees, then apply immediately.

-Design, build, or maintain web sites, using authoring or scripting languages, content creation tools, management tools, and digital media.
-Perform or direct web site updates.
-Write, design, or edit web page content, or direct others producing content.
-Confer with management or development teams to prioritize needs, resolve conflicts, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.

-Proficiency using HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
-Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, asset loading, caching, REST, Thrift)
-Past experience or familiarity with architectural patterns of large, high-scale web or mobile applications
-Demonstrated design and UX sensibilities
-Rigor in A/B testing, test coverage, and other web best practices
-Analytical and strong quantitative skills, plus experience combining code and math
-Familiar with most of the following: Python, PHP, MySQL, Node.js, Laravel, Docker, Vagrant, Debian, Varnish, Nginx, Git, Redis, AngularJS, Bash, Casper.JS, Nagios, Memcached, Solr
